_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Urethane and Other Foam Product (except Polystyrene) Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
See attached file.
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



All employees of CPI Packaging Inc. are provided the following policy statement:



It is the policy of CPI Packaging Inc. to comply with all Environmental, Health and Safety regulations and requirements.  



Upon identifying a circumstance which could lead to a violation of a regulation or requirement established to protect human health, safety, and/or the environment, the person (or persons) identifying the circumstance shall take immediate corrective action, if such action is reasonably within their authority and ability to perform.  Should immediate correction not be performed, the person (or persons) identifying the circumstance shall immediately inform their supervisor, so that appropriate corrective actions can be taken.



Failure to comply with this policy may result in termination of employment.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled



CPI Packaging Inc. manufactures packaging foam.  Iso-butane is used to manufacture packaging foam.



The maximum amount of iso-butane onsite is 32,000 pounds.



General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



CPI Packaging Inc. has developed and implemented a Process Safety Management Program and Risk Management Plan.  CPI Packaging Inc. performs periodic Process Hazards Analyses and routine safety inspections.  The purpose of the program, plan, analyses and inspections are to ensure the safe operation and maintenance of the butane tank and the associated processes.



Five Year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of iso-butane since the facility began operations in 1993.



Emergency Response Program



CPI Packaging Inc. maintains an Emergency Action / Emergency Response Plan.  The primary purpose of this plan is to ensure employee safety in the event of an emergency.  In the event of an accidental release, CPI Packaging Inc. has and conti

nues to work with the City of Lincolnton Fire Department to ensure public safety.  A copy of the Emergency Response Program and Risk Management Plan has been provided to the City of Lincolnton Fire Department.  The City of Lincolnton Fire Department also performs periodic inspections of the butane tank to supplement CPI Packaging Inc.'s routine inspections.  In the event of an accidental release, the City of Lincolnton Fire Department will act as the primary emergency response agency.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety



No specific changes are planned to the regulated process.  CPI Packaging Inc. plans to perform or cooperatively participate in the following safety reviews:



* Self performed routine inspections of the butane tank,

* Self performed periodic Process Hazards Analyses,

* Self performed periodic Process Safety Management Program audits, 

* Self performed periodic Risk Management Plan reviews,

* Insurance carrier inspections,

* City of Lincolnton Fire Department inspections,

* Occupational Health and Safety Administration Consultative Services inspections, and

* North Carolina, Division of Air Quality inspections.



In the event changes are identified through these inspections and/or safety reviews that would improve safety, CPI Packaging Inc. plans to implement such changes.
